str2: A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) intrans: I wonder, marvel, (b) trans: I wonder at, admire. From thauma; to wonder; by implication, to admire.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Of what kind, of what manner. Apparently from pote and the base of pou; interrogatively, whatever, i.e. Of what possible sort.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The wind; fig: applied to empty doctrines. From the base of aer; wind; by implication, quarters.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From hupo and akouo; to hear under, i.e. To listen attentively; by implication, to heed or conform to a command or authority.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
